alert.note: Alert for Bandera (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 10 at 4:58PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Bandera, southeastern Kerr and southwestern Kendall Counties through 530 PM CDT... At 458 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Cypress Creek, or near Comfort, moving southwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kerrville, Comfort, Cypress Creek, Camp Verde, Welfare, Nelson City, Center Point, Kronkosky State Natural Area, Kerrville-Schreiner Park and Waring. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
